de.awi.floenavigation.deployment

Class StaticStationFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • de.awi.floenavigation.deployment.StaticStationFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener

    public class StaticStationFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.Fragment
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener
    This Fragment runs on top of the DeploymentActivity and inserts the Static Station which is being deployed in the Database.

    The Fragment calculates the x,y coordinates of the Static Station from current GPS location of the tablet and inserts the new station in the Database table DatabaseHelper.staticStationListTable.

    See Also:
    DeploymentActivity, ContentValues, Runnable, NavigationFunctions

        private double distance
        Distance of the Static Station from the Origin. Calculated between originLatitude, originLatitude and tabletLat, tabletLon using the Haversine formula

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Default Fragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle). Reads the name and type of the Static Station passed to it by StationInstallFragment. The layout shows a ProgressBar with a waiting message and a cancel button.

        The fragment reads the stationName, stationType, tabletLat, tabletLon passed to it in the Bundle. It then reads the Origin coordinates and calculates and inserts the new station in the Database. It then changes the Layout to show a successful insertion message (changeText) and a Finish button.

        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        savedInstanceState -
        Returns:

      • onClick

        Default Handler for the Finish button on the Screen. MainActivity is started when deployment is complete.
        Specified by:

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called when the Fragment is no longer in foreground. It unregisters the AIS and GPS BroadcastReceivers.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called when the Fragment come back from background to foreground. Disables the Up Button and calls the actionBarUpdatesFunction() to set the correct icon colors in the Action Bar.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.Fragment

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu,
                                android.view.MenuInflater inflater)

      • calculateStaticStationParameters

        private void calculateStaticStationParameters()
        Calculates the location parameters of the Static Station. It calculates and sets distance, theta, alpha, xPosition, yPosition.

      • insertStaticStation

        private void insertStaticStation()
        Inserts the new Static Station and its location paramters into the database table DatabaseHelper.staticStationListTable.
        See Also:
        ContentValues

      • getOriginCoordinates

        private boolean getOriginCoordinates()
        Reads the basic parameters of the Floe's Coordinate system from the Database. Reads the values of originMMSI, originLatitude, originLongitude, beta from their respective tables.
        Returns:
        true if all the values are read successfully.

      • actionBarUpdatesFunction

        private void actionBarUpdatesFunction()
        Registers and implements the BroadcastReceivers for the AIS Connectivity and GPS location broadcasts; which are sent from NetworkMonitor and GPS_Service respectively. The GPS Broadcast receiver sets the value of locationStatus to the value from the GPS_Service. The AIS Connectivity broadcast receiver sets the boolean packetStatus. This also registers Runnable with the Handler statusHandler which runs at a regular interval specified by ActionBarActivity.UPDATE_TIME and it checks the booleans locationStatus and packetStatus and changes the Action Bar icons for GPS and AIS Connectivity accrodingly.
        See Also:
        Runnable, Handler, BroadcastReceiver, ActionBarActivity
